name: places/ChIJD3Ms8Z1ZwokRC7hjsVguLkc
adrFormatAddress: 192 1st Ave., New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: Purchased two bowls and was pleasantly surprised with the kale. It’s a bit pricey but has an excellent taste. Idk if eating it in the street is wise because I immediately had to take a dump after eating half. I guess it’s a good cleanse. If I had to find fault with anything, I wish it wasn’t premade and I could create my own mixture. Nonetheless, I will return.

text.text: Purchased two bowls and was pleasantly surprised with the kale. It’s a bit pricey but has an excellent taste. originalText.text:
Juice Vitality is a cute small place. There isn't much sitting room, this is definitely a take out spot. However, they do have four stools towards the front where you can sit for a few.

The place itself is really cute. Theres multiple menus all over the walls and informational information on the fruits and vegetables in specific drinks, super cool.

The service here is quick and friendly. Prices are reasonable. I've been here twice, ordered two drinks and had them in my hands within 5 minutes. Its ridiculous how fast they move here. My understanding from staff is that they are opened at 7am, so if you come by before work you should be in and out. I need to and will attempt this myself. So far I've only come by after 5pm.

They have boba teas, fresh juices, smoothies and smoothie bowls. I havent been able to try many drinks yet, just three flavors so far. The dragon pitaya is my favorite. Its dragon fruit mixed with pineapple, coconut milk, banana and agave. I've also had the the passion fruit green tea, which is delicious. The last drink I've tried is the mango maddness which has mango, banana, pineapple, orange and coconut milk.

I can't wait to continue coming here and am so happy i ran into this place. It's giving steady customer.

originalText.text: a great hidden gem! a small shop with very delicious and filling acai bowls and smoothies. the pitaya bowl was absolutely packed (also had lots of toppings) so it was very filling and worth every dollar. the lychee valentine smoothie was picked for it's interesting flavour combo. great breakfast spot, you will be getting your money's worth here!

text.text: a great hidden gem! a small shop with very delicious and filling acai bowls and smoothies. the pitaya bowl was absolutely packed (also had lots of toppings) so it was very filling and worth every dollar. the lychee valentine smoothie was picked for it's interesting flavour combo. great breakfast spot, you will be getting your money's worth here!

originalText.text:
Really delicious açaí bowl. 10 bucks with PB. 9 bucks for a regular. Very filling. Good layering. Fresh fruit. Looks a bit small but fills you up.

Staff is very nice too. Overall a great little spot. I think they have smoothies and bubble tea too

originalText.text: Very disappointed, I never got the order.  I placed the order on a rainy day - I had surgery so I’ve been ordering lot… I get it takes longer in bad weather..but they kept pushing back the ETA…from 11:41 …to finally 1pm. If you can’t  delivery during bad weather, turn off the app machines. Two hours for a smoothie and bowl!!! They didn’t cancelled-I had to con at Grubhub to cancel.
